crimm.IO.PDBParser

class crimm.IO.PDBParser(first_model_only=True, include_solvent=True, strict_parser=True, get_header=False, QUIET=False)

PDBParser that returns a Structure with identified chain types from best guesses. The guess is made based on the residue names in each chain, which are compared against a known residue name lookup table (Protein, RNA, solvent, or CHARMM ions).

Inherits from Bio.PDB.PDBParser. :param first_model_only: If True, only the first model in the PDB file is parsed. Default is True. :type first_model_only: bool, optional :param include_solvent: If True, solvent chains are included in the parsed structure. Default is True. :type include_solvent: bool, optional :param strict_parser: If True, the parser operates in strict mode, raising errors for format issues.

If False, the parser operates in permissive mode, issuing warnings instead. Default is True.

Parameters:

  • get_header (bool, optional) – If True, the PDB file header is parsed and stored in the Structure object. Default is False.

  • QUIET (bool, optional) – If True, suppresses warnings during parsing. Default is False.

__init__(first_model_only=True, include_solvent=True, strict_parser=True, get_header=False, QUIET=False)

Create a PDBParser object.

The PDB parser call a number of standard methods in an aggregated StructureBuilder object. Normally this object is instantiated by the PDBParser object itself, but if the user provides his/her own StructureBuilder object, the latter is used instead.

Parameters:

  • false (- PERMISSIVE - Evaluated as a Boolean. If) – constructing the SMCRA data structure are fatal. If true (DEFAULT), the exceptions are caught, but some residues or atoms will be missing. THESE EXCEPTIONS ARE DUE TO PROBLEMS IN THE PDB FILE!.

  • in (exceptions) – constructing the SMCRA data structure are fatal. If true (DEFAULT), the exceptions are caught, but some residues or atoms will be missing. THESE EXCEPTIONS ARE DUE TO PROBLEMS IN THE PDB FILE!.

  • compatibility. (- get_header - unused argument kept for historical)

  • class. (- structure_builder - an optional user implemented StructureBuilder)

  • true (- QUIET - Evaluated as a Boolean. If) – the SMCRA data will be suppressed. If false (DEFAULT), they will be shown. These warnings might be indicative of problems in the PDB file!

  • constructing (warnings issued in) – the SMCRA data will be suppressed. If false (DEFAULT), they will be shown. These warnings might be indicative of problems in the PDB file!

  • parsed. (- is_pqr - Evaluated as a Boolean. Specifies the type of file to be) – If false (DEFAULT) a .pdb file format is assumed. Set it to true if you want to parse a .pqr file instead.
